Founded in 2017 by Dhruv Madhok and Dhruv Bhasin, Arata’s first-ever product, a homemade hair gel, came to being around Madhok’s wedding. Madhok had made the chemical-free hair gel for Bhasin.

24 months later, the D2C brand’s first product was sold on its website and the company took shape. The startup derives its name from the Japanese word ‘Arata’, which means ‘fresh and new.’

Arata finds its differentiation in the chemical-free beauty and skincare segment, and its range includes products such as hair gels, hair creams, shampoos, conditioners, toothpaste, face wash, and serums.

The D2C brand procures ingredients globally and locally from certified organic farms, which are developed into finished products after extensive research and development (R&D). The startup claims to offer zero-chemical and toxic-free personal care products that use only recycled plastic for packaging as part of its sustainability promise.

A majority of its sales take place from ecommerce marketplaces such as Amazon, Nykaa, Flipkart, and bigbasket.

Share your insights! If you've used this product, kindly drop your experience in the comments below.

hashtag#D2C hashtag#FMCG hashtag#Brand hashtag#Entrepreneurship

Here's some tea 🫖

Founded in 2019 by Shrey Jain and Shruti Khare, Alphavedic is a bootstrapped D2C startup that sells Ayurvedic beauty and personal care products. With 24 stock keeping units (SKUs) in its kitty, the startup sells haircare products, shampoos, conditioners, lip balms, creams, among other beauty products.

The startup competes with the likes of The Ayurveda Company, Kapiva, and Forest Essentials.

Alphavedic sells its products through its websites and ecommerce platforms such as Amazon, Nykaa, and Flipkart. It also retails its products across 40 offline chains in India.

Share your insights! If you've used any products, kindly drop your experience in the comments below.

🌟 Celebrating Azure Developer Day 2025! 🌟

On 16th January 2025, we hosted an inspiring Azure Developer Day, bringing together developers, cloud enthusiasts, and tech leaders to explore the limitless possibilities of Microsoft Azure.

This premier event was packed with exciting insights, best practices, and innovative solutions shared by our incredible speakers:
Naveen Verma
Surbhi Agarwal
Shikha Ghildiyal

The event featured insightful sessions on real-world Azure use cases, building scalable and secure cloud solutions, and leveraging Azure AI and DevOps integration for innovation.

A big thank you to everyone who joined us for this incredible day of learning and collaboration! Let’s continue exploring, innovating, and building a connected Azure community together.

hashtag#AzureDeveloperDay hashtag#MicrosoftAzure hashtag#Microsoft hashtag#Innovation hashtag#AzureCommunity

15 Open-Source Projects That Changed the World

To come up with the list, we tried to look at the overall impact these projects have created on the industry and related technologies. Also, we’ve focused on projects that have led to a big change in the day-to-day lives of many software developers across the world.

Web Development
- Node.js: The cross-platform server-side Javascript runtime that brought JS to server-side development
- React: The library that became the foundation of many web development frameworks.
- Apache HTTP Server: The highly versatile web server loved by enterprises and startups alike. Served as inspiration for many other web servers over the years.

Data Management
- PostgreSQL: An open-source relational database management system that provided a high-quality alternative to costly systems
- Redis: The super versatile data store that can be used a cache, message broker and even general-purpose storage
- Elasticsearch: A scale solution to search, analyze and visualize large volumes of data

Developer Tools
- Git: Free and open-source version control tool that allows developer collaboration across the globe.
- VSCode: One of the most popular source code editors in the world
- Jupyter Notebook: The web application that lets developers share live code, equations, visualizations and narrative text.

Machine Learning & Big Data
- Tensorflow: The leading choice to leverage machine learning techniques
- Apache Spark: Standard tool for big data processing and analytics platforms
- Kafka: Standard platform for building real-time data pipelines and applications.

DevOps & Containerization
- Docker: The open source solution that allows developers to package and deploy applications in a consistent and portable way.
- Kubernetes: The heart of Cloud-Native architecture and a platform to manage multiple containers
- Linux: The OS that democratized the world of software development.

Over to you: Do you agree with the list? What did we miss?

–

DeepSeek is a leading AI platform renowned for its cutting-edge models that excel in coding, mathematics, and reasoning. Developed by a Chinese AI company, DeepSeek has garnered significant attention for its high-performing models, such as DeepSeek-V2 and DeepSeek-Coder-V2, which consistently outperform industry benchmarks and even surpass renowned models like GPT-4 and LLaMA3-70B in specific tasks. This exceptional performance, combined with the availability of DeepSeek Free, a version offering free access to certain features and models, makes DeepSeek accessible to a wide range of users, from students and hobbyists to professional developers✅

'My strong obsession to create a GAMERS TAG started with this....' You might mistake this maze of lines for Underground city electricity wires, but it's actually the 1000+ screens of prototype flow of GAMERS TAG from 2021. Built in Adobe XD during my early days as a PM on my entrepreneurial journey. My deep adrenaline of finding hidden problems and solving it by looking at multiple landscapes such as:
📲 Is this product element strong?
⚡️ Can it be marketed effectively?
📊 Does this element support business growth?
📈 Is it scalable?
📚 Is there a learning curve associated with it? If so, how significant is it?
♺ Are there any operational considerations? I know this was just the beginning of something big and dream of becoming best... hashtag#entrepreneurship hashtag#productmanager hashtag#gaming hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Tech hashtag#Startups hashtag#BusinessGrowth

🤖 'Full Stack Developer? Or Just a Backend Dev with Google?' 🔍

💬 'Full-stack magic: 50% backend skills, 50% Google, 100% debugging!'

1️⃣ Full-stack development is not just about coding—it’s about problem-solving.

2️⃣ A great backend developer can figure out the frontend too—with enough Stack Overflow.

3️⃣ The best devs are lifelong learners, always adapting and improving.

4️⃣ Google and documentation are the real MVPs of web development.

5️⃣ True expertise isn’t knowing everything—it’s knowing how to find solutions efficiently.

🚀 'Being a full-stack dev is just knowing which error to Google!'

hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#CodingHumor hashtag#SoftwareEngineering

🚨 OpenAI CEO Sam Altman calls DeepSeek’s R1 model ‘impressive’

Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has praised Chinese startup DeepSeek AI’s R1 model, calling it 'impressive' and invigorating competition in the AI race. DeepSeek-R1 claims to be 20–50x more cost-efficient than OpenAI’s models, with a training cost of just $5.6M—far less than the billions spent by US counterparts.

Marc Andreessen dubbed R1 'AI’s Sputnik moment,' as it rivals giants like GPT-4, Llama, and Gemini. Meanwhile, NVIDIA faced a record $593B market loss amid the AI disruption.

Is R1 a game-changer or just the beginning of a new AI era?

🚀 DeepSeek AI just proved startups can take on OpenAI. Is India next?

A Chinese startup, built in just two months with a lean team, outdated chips, and a shoestring budget, has done the unthinkable—dethroned ChatGPT as the #1 app on the US App Store.

This isn’t just a success story; it’s a wake-up call for Indian founders, engineers, and investors. The AI race isn’t just about deep pockets. It’s about deep hunger.

💡 What’s stopping India from leading the next AI revolution?
🔹 Talent? We have it.
🔹 Data? A goldmine waiting to be tapped.
🔹 Compute power? Expensive, but solvable.
🔹 Risk appetite? That’s the real question.

DeepSeek just showed the world that startups can go toe-to-toe with AI giants. The real question is: Who will be India's DeepSeek?

With Budget 2025 around the corner, every industry has a wishlist. Will this be the year of bold reforms and pro-growth policies? Here’s what key sectors are expecting:

Electric Vehicles (EV)
👉 Uniform 5% taxation across EVs
👉 Subsidies to expand charging infrastructure
👉 Subsidies to boost commercial EV adoption

E-commerce
👉 Lower GST rates to encourage spending
👉 Streamlined imports to strengthen local sourcing
👉 Infrastructure development to optimize logistics

Fintech
👉 Tax breaks to attract investments
👉 Boost AI integration in financial services
👉 Clearer digital lending reforms

Edtech
👉 Tax benefits to make education more accessible
👉 Skilling initiatives to bridge employability gaps
👉 Increased STEM R&D funding

Agritech
👉 Infrastructure development to reduce post-harvest losses
👉 Push for eco-friendly farming practices
👉 Easier credit access for farmers

Which of these reforms should be prioritized? What’s on your budget wishlist? Share your thoughts below.
